meanings.definition: The act of honking a horn.
meanings.sent1: The hornings of the car alerted everyone to move out of the way.
meanings.sent2: The loud hornings of the truck startled the pedestrians.
meanings.sent3: During the parade, the hornings of the vehicles added a musical touch to the event.
meanings.sent4: The hornings of the ship echoed across the harbor, signaling its arrival.
meanings.sent5: The hornings of the geese flying overhead created a symphony in the sky.

meanings.definition: The sound made by a horn.
meanings.sent1: The hornings from the trumpet filled the concert hall with music.
meanings.sent2: The hornings of the train could be heard from a distance.
meanings.sent3: The hornings of the bicycle bell made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The hornings of the foghorn guided the ships safely through the mist.
meanings.sent5: The hornings of the saxophone added a jazzy vibe to the street performance.

meanings.definition: The process of growing or forming horns.
meanings.sent1: The hornings of the young deer were just starting to show.
meanings.sent2: The hornings of the bull made it look majestic and powerful.
meanings.sent3: The hornings of the rhinoceros fascinated the zoo visitors.
meanings.sent4: The hornings of the goat were used for defense against predators.
meanings.sent5: The hornings of the elk were a symbol of strength in the wild.
